Sure, I can help you balance the given chemical equation:

K4Fe(CN)6 + KMnO4 + H2SO4 = KHSO4 + Fe2(SO4)3 + MnSO4 + HNO3 + CO2 + H2O

Here's the balanced equation:

2K4Fe(CN)6 + 3KMnO4 + 3H2SO4 = 2KHSO4 + 2Fe2(SO4)3 + 3MnSO4 + 3HNO3 + 3CO2 + 3H2O

Note that I've added coefficients in front of the formulas of the reactants and products to balance the equation. The coefficients are integer multiples of the stoichiometric coefficients, which are the numbers of molecules of each substance that react or form in the reaction.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
